job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in San Diego, CA

review_title: We know your skill set better then you
job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: my co-workers and I made a great team, we got things done and worked smoothly and efficiently. We addressed student concerns and worked with them.
cons: Upper management has no idea what you do or why you're making decisions and doing your job. Will make you do things outside of your department and get mad when you refuse because its not your skill set. Doesn't understand how people work with the students. Employees are disposable no matter how good you are, no matter how important you are to getting the work done. Will let go of people are suddenly realize no one else can do what they do and expect you to cover for them, then get mad that you don't know how to do the thing. The company doesn't exist without the staff and instructors but they continue to dismiss employees more and more. I honestly think the upper management wants to see how many they can let go and still keep their huge paychecks.

review_title: You are letting a place with great potential run down the drain
pros: It has history, and the potential to be so much more
cons: Never giving credit where credit is due, severe cronyism, having people in leadership positions who have no business being in those positions, a bad rumor mill, salaries are not industry standard, etc

review_title: Has Lots of Potential to Be Great
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in San Diego, CA
pros:
A good deal of autonomy in the classroom
Loved working with the students
Pay was decent for adjunct faculty but not so good for full-timers
cons:
Limited Professional Development
Uninspiring Leadership
Outdated Technology

review_title: Great concept, but lack of execution
pros: Coleman cares a lot about it's students. Instructors are advised to pass students regardless of grades.
cons: Wages are extremely low Management does not listen to its staff nor support them. Classroom textbooks used are 10+ years old.

pros: Good location, adult students ready to study, long history in SD with okay pay and benefits. New management making positive changes.
cons: Hiring inexperienced people without college degrees trying to enroll students in college. High turnover and outdated building and structure.
